channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11026] Provide option to filter out all rows in PerformanceEvaluation tool
item.description:
Performance Evaluation could also be used to check the actual performance of the scans on the Server side by passing Filters that filters out all the rows. We can create a test filter and add it to the Filter.proto and set this filter based on input params. Could be helpful in testing.
If you feel this is not needed pls feel free to close this issue.
item.summary: Provide option to filter out all rows in PerformanceEvaluation tool

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: So, we'd return nothing? I believe Lars Hofhansl had a trick like this.

What's the goal of the custom filter? Why not expose the filter language we already have from HBASE-4176 ? That could be useful, though it requires users know a little bit about the schema (not a requirement currently).
That'd be useful to test server side performance. I do the same thing (using a ValueFitler to filter everything at the server, then measure the time it takes to finish.
This is how the option can be used. Atleast the filter will be useful for testing the server side performance.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12640942/HBASE-11026_1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 javac. The patch appears to cause mvn compile goal to fail.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to cause Findbugs (version 1.3.9) to fail.

Ping!!

I don't see filterAll option in the usage string (I think you added something else recently w/o adding it to the usage string). It should be in the usage string so folks know it exists. Does this thing work for you?

You can add to usage on commit (if it works for you). +1

Good on you ramkrishna vasudevan
This is what I committed. Thanks for the review Stack.

Any chance to get this backported to 0.96 and 0.94?

Any chance to get this backported to 0.96 and 0.94?

We can.
I have a suggestion. can we move the new filter to hbase-client main package itself. Currently it is in hbase-server test package and while trying to use it with YCSB the test package contents are not getting added. May be am not able to write the correct pom.xml for YCSB? am not sure on that. But any way moving to client in the main package would resolve this.
But one thing is adding this filter in the main code may not be correct in terms of user's perspective? What others say?
I'd say fix the YCSB POM rather than move a "return nothing" filter to hbase-client. It's not useful for a user.
